motivi-per-diventare-speaker.brief: Perché non fare un ulteriore passo in avanti e diventare uno speaker?
motivi-per-diventare-speaker.content:
Chi studia o lavora nell’ambito dell’IT sa bene quanto la partecipazione agli eventi tenuti dalle aziende o dalle community sia fondamentale per tenere il passo con quello che è un mondo in perenne evoluzione.

Da una parte anche una semplice partecipazione permette di conoscere nuove idee, venire a conoscenza di storie di successo, ma anche di meno piacevoli, ma non per questo meno costruttivi, fallimenti. Ogni testimonianza permette di evitare passi falsi, scoprire nuove tecnologie e comprenderne il funzionamento o togliersi quel dubbio che spesso affligge per giorni o settimane.

Oltre a questo c’è il networking: conoscere nuove persone, nuove aziende, nuove realtà è sempre un’esperienza che ci arricchisce, sia sul piano personale che professionale.

Perché non fare dunque un ulteriore passo in avanti e diventare uno speaker?

Per i più timidi è giusto evidenziare quanto portare una propria “talk” permetta di prendere dimestichezza con il “public speaking” e vincere i propri timori. Tutti hanno un punto di vista che merita di essere esposto, un’esperienza da raccontare o un’idea da condividere quindi perché non mettersi in gioco?

Se invece il coraggio non manca è necessario ricordare quanto raccontare la propria esperienza e dimostrare le proprie competenze possano giovare alla propria carriera.

Il ritorno di immagine e la pubblicità derivanti dall’esposizione della propria talk si riveleranno infatti elementi costruttivi, sia che si parli a nome della propria azienda o semplicemente si cerchi un modo per mettersi sotto i riflettori e mostrare di cosa si è capaci.

Oltre a questi vantaggi non bisogna dimenticare che quello che accomuna chi partecipa, qualsiasi sia la veste, a questi eventi sono interesse e passione. Se questi ingredienti non mancano o, al contrario, sentite il bisogno di ritrovarli, partecipare ad un evento è quello che fa per voi.

Articolo pubblicato su Medium da GDG Trento
motivi-per-diventare-speaker.title: Motivi per partecipare ed essere speaker alla DevFest

111.description: Partiamo con l'introdurre il concetto di Super-Convergenza dal paper 'Super-Convergence: Very Fast Training of Neural Networks Using Large Learning Rates' (Leslie N. Smith and Nicholay Topin) per apprenderne potenzialità ed esplorare i successivi tentativi, le idee di modifica del metodo originale e le implementazioni in uso fino ad ora
111.title: Super-Convergenza di reti neurali: idea, utilizzo e casi studio

112.description: Dai progetti di startup alle piattaforme enterprise, qualsiasi applicativo in cloud merita una certa attenzione per predire, controllare e governare i costi. Vedremo insieme alcuni pattern, anche molto diversi tra loro, la cui conoscenza può rivelarsi fondamentale per gestire al meglio un progetto in cloud.
112.title: 5 strategie per controllare i costi in cloud (ed evitare di spendere milioni!)

113.description: Remote is finally here, and it's going to stay. In this talk, Marco and Gian will go through what it means to work remotely for a startup — from both a developer and a manager point of view. They'll share some tips and tricks on how to stay organized and focused, how to manage deadlines and the team organization, how to take care of your mental health, and the pros and cons of hiring remotely. They both work for Uniwhere, a venture-backed startup that went remote-first more than two years ago and is now working with 4 different time-zones.
113.title: Remote is here. Now what?

121.description: In questa presentazione vedremo il perché il deep learning è diventato così importante in questi anni e alcuni casì d'uso in diversi settori
121.title: Intro to Deep Learning

122.description: E’ meglio separare i microservizi per layer o per scopo? Quanti gateway devo avere? E’ necessario un pub/sub per far comunicare i microservizi? La persistenza dove la metto? Quali linguaggi uso? Sono alcune delle domande tipiche che ci si pone quando si parte a disegnare e sviluppare una piattaforma moderna basata su microservizi e containers. In questo talk vedremo alcuni stili architetturali e buone pratiche di test, deploy, monitoraggio e business continuity per creare piattaforme robuste e scalabili. Spoiler: non parlerò di Twelve-Factor App :-)
122.title: Stili architetturali in Kubernetes

123.description: La comunicazione tra Dev e Designer: come poter trovare un punto di incontro con i giusti strumenti e tips
123.title: Dev and Designer: due mondi lontani ma vicini

131.description: AI, Machine learning and related sciences will change the way we are working in many industries: for sure the communication world will be heavily impacted by such upcoming technologies. During the session, we are going to see how to use Deep Learning based on Convolutional Neural Network to create a voice recognition engine and Recurrent Neural Network application for sentiment analysis. Design and implementation challenges will also be explained, along with practical examples: we will see how to evaluate the performance of the AI model and how to use some of the main machine learning technique to improve its accuracy.
131.title: AI and Machine Learning: Sentiment Analysis and Voice Biometric applications

132.description: I’ll talk about what’s DNS, why it is important to establish a secure connection to it, existing alternatives and how to self host your own server using Always Free Tier from Google Cloud. Managing your own private DNS server allows you to gain insight on your device’s activity, block malicious requests and protect your traffic from eavesdropping to local hackers when using untrusted WiFi.
132.title: Deploy your private DNS server on Google Cloud for free

133.description: Parlerò dei modelli di business più impattanti sul mercato italiano per creare un'impresa interamente online, automatica e che sia altamente profittevole.
133.title: Come creare un'impresa automatica e gestibile da remoto

141.description: We’re moving fast towards a world without screens, with 30% of all searches set to happen without a screen by 2020. Google’s investing heavily into voice-first interfaces, making it the new touch, and most of it remains uncharted territory, since building for the ear is very different than building for the eyes. This talk is about building a successful product for a voice-first world. Attendees will learn of the similarities and differences when developing for voice compared to screen-oriented mediums, how to create engaging experiences where customers can easily find what they need via voice, and how the conversational design process works.
141.title: Conversational Design for a Voice First World

142.description: Jetpack Compose is an exciting new declarative UI framework from Google. This new approach to UI not only changes how we build our apps, but also the mindset that comes with this part of app development. Compose will help to make our apps far more smoother to build, as well as being more maintable in the long run. It's an exciting time to be an Android developer 🥳 In this fully live coded talk we'll explore the bulding blocks of Jetpack compose - covering not only the foundations, but also enough for you to go away curious and be able to build apps of your own using Jetpack Compose
142.title: Let's build with Compose!

143.description: I explain what the impostor syndrome is and how to deal with it with motivation and reasoning, I deepen the theme of motivation and how to find self-confidence
143.title: Impostor syndrome, motivation and self confidence

151.description: Non sarebbe bello se il Google Home in salotto ci avvertisse che c'è una nuova live su Twitch e, contemporaneamente, la facesse partire sulla TV? Oppure avere un Nest Mini che ci invita a spegnere subito qualche elettrodomestico, prima che l'ENEL ci stacchi la corrente visto che ne stiamo consumando troppa? Tutto possibile, grazie ad Home Assistant, qualche file yaml, device IoT piazzati qua e là, e una manciata di logica per connetterli tra loro. In questa sessione vedremo come configurare un hub domotico domestico, Home Assistant, magari su di un RasPi, come configurarlo, connetterlo ad uno smart speaker Google Nest e creare delle routine per svolgere i compiti più disparati.
151.title: Smart speaker, ancora più smart, con Home Assistant

152.description: Modularizing a project is never easy, a lot of files to move and the dependencies between them is not always what we expect. Then the Dagger configuration used in a single module project often doesn't scale well to a multi module project. Hilt is opinionated about the configuration to use (we don't need to argue anymore about using component dependencies or subcomponents!) and this configuration works perfectly even in a multi module project. In this talk we'll see first an introduction to Hilt and a comparison with Dagger to understand why it's easier to configure. Then we'll see how to leverage it in a multi module project (both in a standard layered architecture and in a Clean Architecture that uses the Dependency Inversion) to improve build speed and code testability. Spoiler alert: using sample apps that include a single feature in the app helps a lot!
152.title: Using Hilt in a multi module project

153.description: In questo talk verrà introdotta la metodologia OKR (objective key result) e spiegato perché da intel a google passando per la melinda and bill gates foundation viene utilizzata per portare avanti progetti di ogni tipo. Il talk verterà sull'esempio di utilizzo per una azienda che vuole mettere in piedi un progetto di diversity e raccontarlo al pubblico.
153.title: OKR, come e perché le grandi aziende dell'IT li usano

161.description: Project Fugu 🐡 is an effort to close gaps in the web's capabilities enabling new classes of applications to run on the web. During the talk, we'll dive into the most exciting features this APIs have to offer.
161.title: Web capabilities AKA project Fugu

162.description: Every application consists of high level features which can be built completely isolated and independent, but what are the benefits of having independent features and when does it make sense to have them? This talk will not only answer those questions, but also show why this was not entirely possible with vanilla Dagger and how new extensions both Hilt and Anvil (previously known as Hepheastus) solve this problem. You will see these libraries in action and learn about one of their core benefits.
162.title: Independent Features - Powered by Dagger Extensions

163.description: R-Ladies Italy è un progetto congiunto tra RLadies Bari e RLadies Milano, due local chapters di RLadies (https://rladies.org/), organizzazione non-profit il cui obiettivo è aiutare donne e minoranze ad accedere al mondo della Data Science, dell'analisi dei dati e della programmazione in R. Il progetto si realizza attraverso una serie di webinars pensati come strumento che permetta di navigare il mare di opportunità professionali legate al settore. Con l'obiettivo di offrire una visione ampia e completa, dedichiamo particolare attenzione soprattutto a ruoli tecnici in settori non tradizionalmente legati alla Data Science, e.g. HR. A fronte del lock-down, le due community di Bari e Milano hanno unito le forze per creare un ecosistema di condivisione, inclusione e supporto reciproco. Molte professioniste del settore hanno deciso di aiutarci nella nostra missione: loro sono le protagoniste dei nostri webinars. Curiosi di scoprire il mondo R-Ladies, le attività, i meetup e come partecipare attivamente all'interno della community? Non perdete questo talk. Parvaneh (RLadies Milano), Giovanna e Sara (RLadies Bari) vi accompagneranno alla scoperta della community.
163.title: R Ladies Italy

171.description: Building a cross-platform app includes thinking about a web strategy but also when it comes to mobile, users want to have a nice native app-like experience, we can achieve this using Progressive Web Apps! But before putting our hands-on, the very first step is to think about architecture and design patterns. During this talk, we are going to deep dive into one example of a Progressive Web App using a serverless architecture built with Firebase and Node.
171.title: Behind the scenes of a Progressive Web App Serverless Architecture

172.description: Since the early days of mobile that we keep seeing new frameworks being designed to overcome one of the biggest challenges: * How can I develop for both Android and iOS? Although it’s initial promises, when we talk about performance, maintainability or even customization we keep discarding these solutions and we always choose native. Fast forward to the present, and now we have two new languages: Android is Kotlin first and iOS, Swift. And if you put them side by side you can see a lot of similarities between both what will ease switching between one to the other if you have to develop for both platforms. But what I told that you could just develop in Kotlin and run it seamlessly on all devices? Here comes Kotlin Multiplatform!
172.title: The Hitchhikers Guide Through Kotlin Multiplatform

173.description: Cosa significa approcciare la crescita di un progetto come farebbe un hacker? Significa seguire le stesse best practice adottate da aziende come Facebook, Uber o Airbnb per ottenere una crescita dirompente. In questa sessione vedremo cosa significa davvero 'Growth Hacking' e perché non si tratta di trucchetti magici, ma di processi per integrare la crescita nel DNA del progetto stesso.
173.title: Hacking Growth - Prodotti Straordinari con Strategie di Distribuzione Non Ordinarie

181.description: Codespaces è un nuovo servizio di GitHub che permette di creare un environment di sviluppo direttamente nel browser. Questo permette ovviamente di poterlo utilizzare da qualsiasi device e soprattutto creare un ambiente con versioni specifiche di librerie e tool, risparmiando così un sacco di tempo prezioso. In questa sessione vedremo come iniziare a utilizzare Codespaces e sfruttarne pure l’integrazione con Visual Studio Code.
181.title: Niente più ambiente di sviluppo locale con GitHub Codespaces

182.description: If you're developing mobile apps, you probably know what's one of your most important KPI: Store Rating. In such an environment, speed is key. You want to be able to iterate fast and ship beautiful apps to your users frequently. But with growing mobile teams, this is becoming more and more challenging. The Mobile DevOps imposes a prospective shift to the 'classical' DevOps perspective. Tools and processes should be adapted to the mobile release flow. You need to have tools to monitor your application, rollout a feature safely, and react to incident and 1-star reviews. Mobile DevOps engineers to the rescue. They play a fundamental role in adapting your development flow to deliver mobile apps to your end-users. In this talk, I will share my experience as a Mobile DevOps engineer, some of my preferred tools, and some of the lessons learned while building mobile infrastructures.
182.title: Tales of a Mobile DevOps

183.description: Il Personal Branding ti permette di comunicare il tuo valore, costruire la tua autorità e creare fiducia nella tua audience. Solo grazie alla fiducia che le persone avranno in te potrai attrarre il tuo cliente ideale. Fare Personal Branding significa appropriarsi dell'immagine che le persone hanno di te, della sensazione che susciti negli altri e comunicare ciò che desideri, controllando la percezione che le persone hanno di te e condividendo il tuo valore. In questo speech vedremo i 5 step chiave per costruire il tuo Personal Brand, un leader di riferimento nella tua nicchia e attrarre il cliente ideale su LinkedIn.
183.title: Personal Branding su LinkedIn i 5 step chiave

191.description: Costruisci un termometro bluetooth con Flutter ed Arduino
191.title: Un termometro bluetooth DIY con Flutter e Arduino

192.description: A brief and fast paced introduction on what is Flutter, how can flutter can be useful for you day by day developers need and why you can trust Flutter enough for chosing this framework for your next production level application
192.title: What The Flutter

193.description: Lo studio delle keyword e dell'intento di ricerca ci permette di analizzare una nicchia, il pubblico di riferimento e i contenuti da creare per sviluppare un sito web che permetta a 'domanda' e 'offerta' di incontrarsi.
193.title: Come trovare il Principe Azzurro: un esempio di keyword research a lieto fine

211.description: Quindi...potreste non essere necessariamente un grande team di sviluppatori distribuiti in tutto il mondo. Ma avete diverse app disperse nella vostra azienda (backend e frontend) che hanno bisogno di essere integrate tra di loro? Oppure avete una libreria di componenti UI riutilizzabili condivisa con tutti i vostri gruppi di sviluppo? O forse non ce l'avete perché la pubblicazione è difficile, il versioning è ancora più complesso, per non parlare poi della retrocompatibilità! In questa presentazione vi mostro come grandi aziende come ad esempio Google, Facebook e Microsoft affrontano questo problema, perché un monorepo potrebbe essere una buona scelta e come il toolkit open source Nx, in particolare, può aiutarvi in questo.
211.title: Beyond Basics - Scaling Development across large teams

212.description: Flutter app development is fast? But do you know that you can make it faster? Are you having trouble with making responsive UIs or do you want to utilize the powerful extension methods? If your answer to any of these questions is yes then this talk is for you. In this talk, I'll explain this new microframework VelocityX which is a minimalist Flutter framework inspired by TailwindCSS and SwiftUI for rapidly building custom designs and comes with many handy utilities.
212.title: Supercharging your app with VelocityX

213.description: What are the problems (and how to resolve them) that a new member of the team is facing during a remote onboarding. I want to share my experience.
213.title: The remote onboarder

221.description: In questa sessione di live coding realizzeremo un semplice progetto Angular con l’integrazione di NGRX, lo state manager reattivo più utilizzato in ambito enterprise che si ispira al famoso pattern Redux. Una breve sessione in cui, non solo configureremo lo store, creeremo reducer, effects e selettori, ma parleremo anche di struttura moduli, organizzazione progetti enterprise, manutenzione e scalabilità del codice.
221.title: State management in Angular e NGRX (live-coding)

222.description: 'Flutter is more than just an engine, a set of widgets, and some tools; it also includes a large ecosystem of packages to add functionality to your apps beyond what comes out of the box.' Today, the Flutter ecosystem has more than 12,000 packages and new packages are being added to pub.dev everyday. As the package landscape is getting more and more vast, developers often find themselves searching for suitable packages tirelessly and sometimes end up reinventing the wheel. This talk will introduce upcoming Flutter developers to the current Flutter package landscape (including package discovery tools) and will also cover some state-of-the-art methods which should be followed when publishing a new Flutter package to gain a wider adoption.
222.title: Navigating the Flutter Ecosystem - Journey from Package Discovery to Publishing and Beyond

223.description: Alcune volte, involontariamente, si creano prodotti e algoritmi che non sono così etici e/o inclusivi. In questa sessione vediamo qualche esempio di come, in alcuni casi, involontariamente o per errore algoritmi e progetti hanno tralasciato gli aspetti d'inclusione e di eticità. Nulla di tecnico, esclusivamente qualche spunto di riflessione per imparare dagli errori e rendere il mondo un posto migliore (per tutti) :)
223.title: Algoritmi e Software Etici

231.description: Micro-frontends sono un nuovo trend nelle architetture Frontend. Questa architettura, basata sui principi dei microservizi, offre molteplici benefici quando usata su progetti medio-grandi con diversi team che lavorano sullo stesso prodotto. Grazie al lavoro svolto in DAZN, Luca Mezzalira condividerà la sua esperienza sul campo enfatizzando uno dei mental framework da lui creati chiamato Micro-Frontends Decisions Framework. Il framework permette di definite i 4 pilastri per il corretto design di una architettura a micro-frontends
231.title: Micro-Frontends Decisions Framework

232.description: Android is an ever-growing ecosystem and most API are unknown to most of the devs out there. In this talk, we will travel across some of these API to see those that you might not see in your day to day life.
232.title: Fantastic API and where to find them

233.description: Malgrado i molti passi in avanti nella lotta alla disparità, persiste, in alcuni casi, un linguaggio ormai datato e una rappresentazione stereotipata delle donne che lavorano nel mondo scientifico e tecnologico. Vi propongo un analisi storica di questo fenomeno con testimonianze dirette di ricercatrici, professioniste del settore e giornaliste che permettano di riflettere e interrogarsi sui i passi necessari per una comunicazione e un linguaggio maggiormente inclusivo.
233.title: Comunicazione inclusiva nel mondo scientifico e tecnologico

241.description: Traditionally, when developers wanted to distribute their web-based apps through app stores like Google Play, there was only one option: Apache Cordova. In the meantime, Progressive Web Apps (PWA) have arrived. The life of a PWA starts in the browser, and users can choose to install the application to the home screen for faster access. Still, there are lots of reasons why developers might want to distribute their applications via app stores. With the help of Trusted Web Activities (TWA) and Bubblewrap, developers can distribute their existing PWA through the Play Store for Android and Chrome OS, combining the power of both worlds.
241.title: Shipping a PWA as an Android app using Bubblewrap

242.description: After a political earthquake Huawei and Honor newest smartphone cannot run Google Mobile Services and Google Play anymore. Your cool app probably will not run fully in this new world. But all is not lost, it is still Android, and Huawei offers plenty of APIs to supply the lack of the GMS functionalities: the Huawei Mobile Services (HMS). You will learn how to make the appropriate lifting to your app to make it compatible with the HMS and the AppGallery app-store, supports both stores and make your users happy.
242.title: Adapt your Android app for the HMS new world

243.description: I would like to talk about how to implement and test accessibility in Android apps. I will cover all the aspects including manual as well as automation testing. I will use theory as well as coding samples in this session.
243.title: Accessibility in Android world

251.description:
Developing a native kubernetes app goes around two simple concepts: defining new data structures (custom resources) and delivering a kubernetes component that handles those structures. Despite that, doing the first steps can be intimidating: how do we define (and consume) new resources? How about interacting with existing resources defined by somebody else? How do I even find their Go definition? In this talk, I'll introduce:
- how to interact with kubernetes custom resource using non type safe clients
- how to leverage the code generation to avoid casting errors and reduce the proliferation of boilerplate code
- how informers, workqueues and other powerful tools make it possible to implement a bullet proof event loop
- Finally, I'll describe the operator-sdk, a framework that makes the implementation of a controller even simpler and more automated The audience will walk away with a solid understanding on how the codebase of a kubernetes controller looks like, how to read it and how to leverage the tools required to be able to write a kubernetes controller.
251.title: It's all about reconciliation - anatomy of a kubernetes controller

252.description: In this session I explain how to leverage bayesian optimization in order to draft the best DNN architecture for your TensorFlow projects
252.title: Bayesian Optimization for Neural Architecture Search

253.description: One of the most powerful software quality tools are code reviews - an activity in which a developer, other than the author, examines a software deliverable for defects, and improvement opportunities. For a new Engineer, a code review can be a valuable learning resource, and for a more experienced Engineer it can be a good teaching mechanism when done properly. Whether you are a fresh college graduate, or a Senior Engineer with multiple years of experience under your belt, this talk will take you on the journey of a team that transformed their code review process from being vague and lacking, to being the biggest investment of their resulting, high quality code output. By the end of this talk your perspective on code reviews should change and you will approach code reviews as what they really are - a Software Engineer's Best Friend (woof! woof!)
253.title: Code Review, A Software Engineer's Best Friend

261.description: Estratto da un vero progetto, pipeline di analisi dati raccolti da tracker gps veicolari usando strumenti della Google Cloud Platform.
261.title: Road risk analysis with Google Cloud serverless tools

262.description: Overview sui sistemi di raccomadazione della piattaforma di streaming musicale di Spotify: la costruzione di una business intelligence per il miglioramento della customer experience e la customer satisfation.
262.title: Come Spotify migliora la customer satisfaction utilizzando l’intelligenza artificiale

263.description: What is coaching, simple tools that can be applied in daily life
263.title: Coaching boosts your daily life

271.description: È un player ancora molto giovane e non è chiaro se è una meteora o qualcosa che resterà sul mercato e ritaglierà una fetta della torta...ma proviamo a capire insieme cosa offre questo nuovo runtime per Javascript che vanta maggiore sicurezza rispetto a Node e la possibilità di utilizzare TypeScript...e non solo!
271.title: Deno - L'anagramma di Node

272.description: Machine Learning (ML) models have become very popular in recent years due to the capabilities they offer by adding to our applications with seemingly intelligent behaviors and predictive analytics systems. Everyone talks about prediction models, learning models, neuron networks and Deep Learning. But the big question is how we can automate the learning/building and deployment processes. In this talk, I will explain what Machine Learning is and which are the different families of algorithms that exist to build our ML models. I will also describe How the life cycle of the ML models work in order to understand how this process can be automated and monitored. The need for automation will lead me to explain what Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) is and how we can deploy them into Google Cloud Platform (GCP) by means of Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Pipelines, Jupyter Notebooks and Hub AI.
272.title: Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) in GCP

273.description: In questo speech illustrerò il mio processo logico con schemi e mappe mentali complete per capire se la nostra comunicazione in rete è digital oriented oppure siamo rimasti fermi ai segnali di fumo. Infine presenterò un caso di studio reale di ristrutturazione del marketing per la vendita di strumenti e servizi di smart working digitale.
273.title: Come comunicare online nel 2020

281.description: GraphQL is the easy way to do the hard stuff for developers! In this session, we show how to set-up and manage a hosted, serverless, and secure GraphQL API in minutes. Then we will extend it with relationships to other data collections and custom resolvers to bundle together different data sources and APIs together under the same schema. Finally, we will build out an entire web application using our GraphQL endpoint to demonstrate how GraphQL gives us exactly the data we want- nothing more, nothing less.
281.title: GraphQL: The Easy Way to Do The Hard Stuff

282.description: AI forte prevede un uso simbolico formale di logica in grado di spiegare in modo non ambiguo le inferenze, ML impara da sola usando metodi matematici di approssimazione, ottimizzazione e statistica che vanno alimentati con cura. Il futuro prevede una ibridazione dei due approcci e quello che noi presentiamo in questo incontro come anello di congiunzione sono i modelli concettuali (o semantici).
282.title: AI, ML e l'anello mancante

283.description: Questo talk vuole porre l'attenzione su quanto le community e l'open source sono importanti. In community si può esprimere il proprio pensiero senza nessuna paura, questo fa sì che si possa uscire dal proprio guscio e che si possano stringere rapporti di collaborazione ed amicizia duratura. D'altra parte anche il mondo open source ci permette di crescere perché la collaborazione con altri developer ci può insegnare molto. Ci saranno ottimi consigli per iniziare con l'open source e una live che mostrerà come contribuire ad un progetto....ma non é tutto, c'è molto di più da dire su questi due favolosi mondi 😊
283.title: Lunga vita a community 🥳 & open source 💻

291.description: Lynn is actually Google Cloud Expert, Microsoft Regional Director, and AWS Community Hero. The interview will be a nice chat between 2 GDE Cloud Ladies, Lynn from the USA and Antonella from Europe about the current and future methodologies and strategies, not only Cloud, not only Google. A great opportunity for discussion made even more significant by your questions in the Q&A section.
291.title: Lynn Langit - Interview with the first Google Expert ever

292.description: Gli algoritmi genetici sono una classe di algoritmi di intelligenza artificiale ed in particolare della branca della computazione evolutiva. Sono utilizzati per tentare di risolvere problemi di ottimizzazione per i quali non sono note soluzioni a complessità lineare o polinomiale.
292.title: Processi evolutivi attraverso algoritmi genetici

293.description: Parlare in pubblico fa paura, soprattutto se sei timida, introversa, ansiosa e con poca autostima. Cento, trena, dieci persone, a volte anche solo una: le ginocchia tremano, la voce muore in gola, le mani sudato. E le nostri migliori idee restano intrappolate in testa, bloccate da un muro di pensieri negativi, vergogna e paura. Come superare queste emozioni e parlare davanti a un pubblico? Come esprimere meglio quello che già comunichiamo? Come far arrivare agli ascolatori il nostro messaggio, manenendo alto il livello di attenzione e magari coinvolgendoli nel discorso? In questo talk fornirò vari suggerimenti utili a chi vuole parlare in pubblico con un po' meno ansia e molta più chiarezza nell'esposizione.
293.title: Public Speaking per chiacchieroni timidi

301.description: I am Remarkable è il workshop di Google incentrato sulla motivazione e sulla corretta autopromozione di se stessi. Posti limitati. Per partecipare al workshop è richiesta l'iscrizione tramite il form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf-dycCwqY4M-oI0I9uRonVprUcqibSfUVJSGLz1H6vISoTtw/viewform
301.title: I am Remarkable

302.description: WORKSHOP Creative Problem Solving: stimolare l’intelligenza creativa e risolvere problemi del new normal (online/offline). Il creative problem solving è un metodo strutturato per immaginare rapidamente nuove soluzioni a problemi complessi. Molto utile in tempi di trasformazione, permette di allenare l’intelligenza creativa di squadra al servizio dell’innovazione. Non si cercano semplicemente soluzioni, ma soluzioni inedite, con un processo che associa l'utile al dilettevole tramite una dinamica ludica. Non sarete semplici spettatori, ma partecipanti al 100%. Posti limitati, iscrizione tramite il form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoI19Ecb_6R8f3WAX38wdI-zk9MmkdVXUVtp7sfGNHRji45A/viewform
302.title: Creative Problem Solving Online

ElisaContessotto.bio: Mi occupo dell’area formazione di SEOZoom. Tra un caffè e un Prosecco ho orientato i miei interessi verso la Business Intelligence e la Keyword Research coniugando l'approccio creativo a quello analitico.
ElisaContessotto.name: Elisa Contessotto
ElisaContessotto.title: Formatrice, SEOZoom

GiuliaVillirilli.bio: I am Giulia Villirilli, a certified coach for leadership and transformation. I help my clients break through their plateau and be a living inspiration. I have an international business background (MBA) and 9+ years of experience living and working abroad. I worked as Account Manager of one of the major players in the Automotive Industry, with focus on the German market, and had additional professional experiences related to international trade fairs, public speaking and marketing. My background as an expat and my willingness to learn and improve serve me well in my profession as a coach, as they facilitate the understanding of different perspectives. The topics I coach the most are: leadership, self-development, courage, decision making and resilience. As a certified professional coach, I serve the client as a reliable partner in the coaching journey: from establishing trust, to developing awareness and moving to action
GiuliaVillirilli.name: Giulia Villirilli
GiuliaVillirilli.shortBio: Certified coach for leadership and transformation
GiuliaVillirilli.title: Certified coach for leadership and transformation

LucaMezzalira.bio: Being associated with the industry since 2004, I have lent my expertise predominantly in the solution architecture field. As a Vice President of Architecture at DAZN—a cloud-based sports video platform that offers content to a sizeable user base, for which I administer various OTT-centric issues involving governance, scalability and resilience. Being associated with DAZN, I have gained accolades for revolutionising the scalability of frontend architectures with micro-frontends, from increasing the efficiency of workflows, to delivering quality in products. My colleagues know me as an excellent communicator who believes in using an interactive approach for understanding and solving problems of varied scopes. My core industry knowledge has been instrumental in resolving complex architectural and integration challenges. I have worked towards shaping the evolution of our platform across various targets from Web, TV and mobiles to desktops, set-top boxes and embedded devices. Working within the scopes of a plethora of technical roles such as tech lead, solutions architect and CTO, I have developed a precise understanding of various technicalities which has helped me in maximizing value of my company and products in my current leadership roles
LucaMezzalira.name: Luca Mezzalira
LucaMezzalira.shortBio: VP of Architecture at DAZN | Google Developer Expert | O'Reilly author | International Speaker
LucaMezzalira.title: VP of Architecture at DAZN | Google Developer Expert | O'Reilly author | International Speaker

FabioBiondi.bio: Fabio Biondi, Microsoft MVP e Google Developer Expert in web technologies con specializzazione in Angular, è uno sviluppatore freelance con più di 15 anni di esperienza nella creazione di applicazioni web enterprise. Speaker in numerosi eventi front-end, ha inoltre fondato diverse community italiane che si occupano di Javascript, Angular e React (~ 20000 membri). Attualmente si occupa di formazione e consulenza su Javascript, Typescript, Angular, React, Redux, NGRX e RxJS.
FabioBiondi.name: Fabio Biondi
FabioBiondi.shortBio: Microsoft MVP | Google Expert in Web Technologies & Angular
FabioBiondi.title: Microsoft MVP | Google Expert in Web Technologies & Angular

badges.description: Google Developers Expert - Angular, Web Technologies
badges.name: gde

LucaBarboni.bio: Imprenditore, Public Speaker, Growth Hacker. Autore del 1° libro italiano sul tema. Founder & VP of Growth @ 247X, l’unica agenzia di growth hacking italiana partner di GrowthHackers.com. #500strong.
LucaBarboni.name: Luca Barboni
LucaBarboni.shortBio: Founder & VP of Growth @ 247X | ITA Partner di Growthhackers.com | Imprenditore, Autore & Public Speaker
LucaBarboni.title: Founder & VP of Growth @ 247X | ITA Partner di Growthhackers.com | Imprenditore, Autore & Public Speaker

MaurizioMangione.bio: Google Developers Expert for web technologies, Microsoft MVP, Milano JS, Italia JS and JS Girls founder. Self-motivated passionate community professional focused on building engaging, valuable connections between people and organisations. Deep experience of building communities, both in-person and online across many groups and domains. Expert in growing brand awareness and showcasing brand values. Rock climber and metal guitar player.
MaurizioMangione.name: Maurizio Mangione
MaurizioMangione.title: Developer Relations Advocate at DAZN

RobertoOrgiu.bio: Born in Italy in 1987, passionate for everything that switches on and off and particularly for handheld and wearable devices. I love to learn new languages such as Kotlin, patterns and everything Android-related. I recently joined The New York Times Android team as Android Engineer.
RobertoOrgiu.name: Roberto Orgiu
RobertoOrgiu.title: Android Engineer @ NYTimes

badges.description: Google Developers Expert - Android, Identity, Internet of Things, Kotlin
badges.name: gde

GiulioRoggero.bio: Il mio focus principale è semplificare la vita a sviluppatori e IT operations con Mia-Platform, uno dei primi Digital Integration Hub out-of-the-box al mondo. Ad oggi aiuto più di 70 persone dei team di Mia (software engineers, product owners, IT operations, UX designers) a creare un prodotto che semplifica lo sviluppo su Kubernetes.
GiulioRoggero.name: Giulio Roggero
GiulioRoggero.shortBio: Founder & CTO Mia-Platform, Partner & CS Intré, Founder Agile Reloaded
GiulioRoggero.title: Founder & CTO Mia-Platform, Partner & CS Intré, Founder Agile Reloaded

LucaMassaron.bio: Data scientist transforming data into smarter artifacts. Author of For Dummies books on AI, machine learning and algorithms. Kaggle master.
LucaMassaron.name: Luca Massaron
LucaMassaron.title: Google Developer Expert

AliceMarmieri.bio: Da oltre 10 anni mi occupo di Online Marketing e Innovazione. Dopo numerosi anni come Marketing Manager in aziende multinazionali del calibro di Google e Luxottica ho deciso di intraprendere la mia avventura imprenditoriale e fondare Marte Digital, azienda di consulenza e formazione in ambito digitale, certificata Google Digital Trainer e partner del Corriere Economia. Le mie esperienze come manager in azienda, imprenditrice e consulente mi hanno insegnato l'importanza di saper comunicare il proprio valore in modo efficace a clienti, manager e la propria audience. Per questo motivo dal 2017 affianco imprenditori, leader d'azienda e professionisti a creare il proprio Personal Brand per diventare dei leader nel proprio settore. La mia missione è aiutare professionisti straordinari a comunicare il proprio valore, costruire la propria autorità e attrarre il cliente ideale grazie al Personal Branding.
AliceMarmieri.name: Alice Marmieri
AliceMarmieri.title: Consulente Personal Branding & LinkedIn Expert

DiegoGosmar.bio: Successful international speaker, Diego Gosmar is a manager with over 20 years of experience in the ICT sector and a writer with passion for innovation. He is author of the new book “Machine Learning - The sixth chakra of Artificial Intelligence” Published on August 2020 - ISBN: 979-8674459958. In 2010 Diego and his partners were rewarded for having founded Xenialab: best innovative start-up at the I3P incubator of the Turin Polytechnic University. Diego has led the international expansion of the XCALLYTM omni-channel software solution, reaching over 50 countries worldwide, managing partners and hundreds of customers scattered from Singapore to the Middle East, Europe, South Africa, the United States, Brazil and others. Since December 2019 Xenialab has become part of the INGO Spa group and Diego has been focusing on the growth of international operations. Diego's experience is linked to Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence (AI) with particular attention to speech analysis, sentiment analysis and customer service applications through advanced forecasting and IVR models.
DiegoGosmar.name: Diego Gosmar
DiegoGosmar.title: VP International Operations - INGO Spa

GabrieleMittica.bio: Sviluppatore dal 2004, sono co-ideatore della CloudConf e promotore di diversi eventi informatici. Appassionato di cloud computing, innovazione, cucina, canottaggio e birrificazione casalinga
GabrieleMittica.name: Gabriele Mittica
GabrieleMittica.title: Co-founder di Corley e CloudConf

FabioCollini.bio: Fabio Collini is a Google Developer Expert for Android and Kotlin. He started Android development in 2009, first as a freelance with two apps on Play Store and then as a developer for some companies and startups. Now he works as a remote engineer in the Android team at the New York Times. He is one of the authors of the second edition of Android Programmazione Avanzata, an Italian book dedicated to some advanced aspects of Android development, and he publishes articles about Android and Kotlin on his medium profile.
FabioCollini.name: Fabio Collini
FabioCollini.shortBio: Android e Kotlin GDE - Android Engineer at The New York Times
FabioCollini.title: Android e Kotlin GDE - Android Engineer at The New York Times

badges.description: Google Developers Expert - Android e Kotlin
badges.name: gde

JuriStrumpflohner.bio: Juri Strumpflohner was born and lives in South Tyrol. He is currently a JavaScript Architect and Engineering Manager at Nrwl, where he consults for some of the world's biggest companies around the globe. Juri is very involved in the community. Since a couple of years he's a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies, speaks at international conferences, teaches on [Egghead.io](http://egghead.io) and also co-organizes the Craftsmanship South Tyrol Meetup group. Make sure you connect with him on Twitter @juristr or on juri.dev.
JuriStrumpflohner.name: Juri Strumpflohner
JuriStrumpflohner.shortBio: Web Technologies GDE - JavaScript Architect & Engineering Manager @ Nrwl
JuriStrumpflohner.title: Web Technologies GDE - JavaScript Architect & Engineering Manager @ Nrwl

AntonellaBlasetti.bio: Founder and co-owner of Information Design, an IT Consulting Company. Google Expert Cloud. Certifications: AWS Solutions Architect, Azure Solution Architect Expert, Associate GOOGLE CLOUD Associate Engineer , Professional Data Engineer, Professional Cloud Architect and Professional Cloud Developer, ORACLE Database Administrator Neo4j Certification. Passionate about Machine Learning and Big Data. Since 2011, Google Developer Group GDG ROMA Founder and co-Leader. With our help, many people managed to improve their professional life, to get a better job, and to gain more self-confidence and motivation. I am really proud of it and I am grateful to Google for giving me this opportunity. Application and System Engineer in the International SW Development Lab of IBM in Italy. Professor of Relational Database Design at the University La Sapienza of Rome. Temporary manager (IT and Finance) in the Daimler (Mercedes) Outsourcing Company; Part in international task forces for defining valuation and transfer strategies of all the assets of big data centers (IBM Mainframes). International Software Projects and Big experience in Databases and Data/System Integration
AntonellaBlasetti.name: Antonella Blasetti
AntonellaBlasetti.shortBio: IT Manager Information Design - Google Developer Expert Cloud - AWS e GCP Cloud Certified - Leader Google Developer Group Roma
AntonellaBlasetti.title: IT Manager Information Design - Google Developer Expert Cloud - AWS e GCP Cloud Certified - Leader Google Developer Group Roma

JavierProvechoFernandez.bio: Javier Provecho works at Telefónica, engages with the community as a Cloud GDE and open source maintainer. He is passionate about new technologies and methodologies around the CNCF.
JavierProvechoFernandez.name: Javier Provecho Fernandez
JavierProvechoFernandez.shortBio: Cloud GDE, Senior SRE at Telefónica / 11Paths
JavierProvechoFernandez.title: Cloud GDE, Senior SRE at Telefónica / 11Paths

LauraMorinigo.bio: Laura is a software developer, advocate, and mentor. She has been involved in the tech industry for over 10 years, working as a full-stack developer and getting involved with education projects teaching coding in cities like New York and Buenos Aires. She has been recognized as a Google Developer Expert and a Woman Techmakers Ambassador, as a mentor she helped startups participating in accelerator programs like Google Launchpad and the World Food Programme by the United Nations. Currently, she is a web developer advocate for Samsung Internet at Samsung Research Institute UK where the team contributes to open source projects, build demos and participate in conferences getting the word out about advanced web features helping web developers to create great and more inclusive web apps.
LauraMorinigo.name: Laura Morinigo
LauraMorinigo.title: Firebase GDE, Developer Advocate

EmanueleBartolesi.bio: I'm a Full Stack Web Developer and I'm passionate about frontend technologies and everything related to the cloud, especially Microsoft Azure. I currently live in Zurich and actively participate in local and international community activities and events. I share my love for technology through my blog in Italian https://www.emanuelebartolesi.com and the one in English https://dev.to/kasuken. I also became Twitch Affiliate as a live coder and you can follow me at https://twitch.tv/kasuken to write some code together. Since 2014 I'm Microsoft MVP in the Developer Technologies category.
EmanueleBartolesi.name: Emanuele Bartolesi
EmanueleBartolesi.title: Microsoft MVP & ASP.NET Core Ninja

JunaSalviati.bio: Juna has always been curious about technology and computers so she wrote her first line of code at 10. She continued to write code and graduated as a Software Engineer. She have always been cultivating a passion for classical studies, humanities and is fascinated by communication studies and human-machine interaction.
JunaSalviati.name: Juna Salviati
JunaSalviati.title: Software Engineer

LucaDiVita.bio: Master degree in Engineering of computers at Università degli studi de L'Aquila. Enthusiast of Cyber Security and Machine Learning.
LucaDiVita.name: Luca Di Vita
LucaDiVita.title: Machine Learning Engineer presso AESYS

MichelaSessi.bio: Ha una formazione teorica tecnica statistica grazie alla laurea triennale in Statistica e Gestione delle Informazioni ed è stata tra i primi 13 laureati al corso di laurea magistrale in Data Science all'Università di Milano Bicocca. A Dicembre 2019 entra a far parte del team di Innovazione R&D di Kirey Group come Data Scientist con focus Machine Learning.
MichelaSessi.name: Michela Sessi
MichelaSessi.title: Data Scientist @ Kirey Group

LorenzaDeBerardinis.bio: Formazione statistica, data-driven oriented. Attratta dal fascino della tecnologia e dell’innovazione e sono alla ricerca di conoscenze sempre nuove. La musica è il sottofondo indispensabile per tutte le mie attività. Attualmente Business Analyst presso Aesys
LorenzaDeBerardinis.name: Lorenza De Berardinis
LorenzaDeBerardinis.title: Business Analyst, AESYS

MoiśesMartínez.bio: I am a PhD in Artificial Intelligence specialized in the areas of robotics, automatic planning and machine learning. In addition, I am organizer of T3chfest and Madrid Google Cloud Developer group, speaker at different meetups and GDE on Machine Learning.
MoiśesMartínez.name: Moiśes Martínez
MoiśesMartínez.shortBio: Machine Learning GDE & ML, TensorFlow, GCP Specialist
MoiśesMartínez.title: Machine Learning GDE & ML, TensorFlow, GCP Specialist

GiorgioBoa.bio: Giorgio Boa was born in 1987 and lives in Treviso, Italy. He is a t-shaped developer and the front-end ecosystem is his passion. He started to develop application in 2006 and in 2012 he falls in love with JavaScript. He is also active in open source ecosystem, he loves learn and studies new things. He is very ambitious and he tries to improve himself every day.
GiorgioBoa.name: Giorgio Boa
GiorgioBoa.title: T-shaped developer in Targa Telematics

FrancescoLoMonaco.bio: Life Coach,Tecnologo, già ideatore della community online Cupido.it con oltre 10.000 iscritti (exit 2018 con Register.it), oggi aiuto e supporto Imprenditori, Liberi Professionisti, Marketing Manager, Digital Marketer e Freelance ad aggiornare il proprio modo di comunicare online e di proporre i loro servizi in modo tale che siano accattivanti e desiderati dal loro pubblico di riferimento.
FrancescoLoMonaco.name: Francesco Lo Monaco
FrancescoLoMonaco.title: Marketing Manager di Comunicare.Online

NicoleBartolini.bio: Sono una Pokémon Master in pensione con oltre 20 anni di esperienza, la peggior snowboarder d’Europa, una metallara a tempo perso e un’amante dei carboidrati. Aiuto le persone a lavorare più felicemente: sono una consulente per la Digital Transformation e una community manager, ciecamente convinta che le persone appassionate lavorino meglio e raggiungano risultati migliori. Sono la fondatrice e coordinatrice di PUG Romagna e devRomagna, due community di sviluppatori per sviluppatori, create con l’obiettivo di diffondere le buone pratiche e condividere conoscenza.
NicoleBartolini.name: Nicole Bartolini
NicoleBartolini.title: IT Consultant & Community Manager

AlfredoMorresi.bio: Mi appassiona supportare l'innovazione grazie alle dinamiche di community e alla tecnologia. Lavoro nel team Developer Relations di Google. Adoro scrivere codice, la natura, l’open source, correre lungo la spiaggia, fare snowboard e mangiare tiramisù.
AlfredoMorresi.name: Alfredo Morresi
AlfredoMorresi.title: Developer Relations @ Google

FedericoPaolinelli.bio: Federico works remotely for Red Hat, contributing to network features of the OpenShift container platform. Before that, he has been working for more than 10 years implementing complex distributed systems in the finance field. Beyond that, he is an active opensource supporter with contributions to various projects, Firefox for Android and Athens, the go dependency proxy among the others.
FedericoPaolinelli.name: Federico Paolinelli
FedericoPaolinelli.shortBio: Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat
FedericoPaolinelli.title: Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat

JoeBirch.bio: Hi, my names Joe. I’m an Android Engineer and Google Developer Expert for Android, Google Pay and Flutter based in Brighton, UK working on the Android team at Buffer. I’m passionate about coding and love creating robust, polished and exciting projects for mobile, the web, TV, wearables and I’ll probably be toying with whatever the new thing is at the time you’re reading this – I love to be constantly learning. I’m also a keen writer as I love to share my learnings and experiences with others.
JoeBirch.name: Joe Birch
JoeBirch.shortBio: Android, Google Pay and Flutter GDE & Senior Engineer @ Buffer
JoeBirch.title: Android, Google Pay and Flutter GDE & Senior Engineer @ Buffer

badges.description: Google Developers Expert - Android, Google Pay and Flutter
badges.name: gde

KarenHuaulme.bio: As a Developer Advocate at MongoDB, Karen Huaulmé (pronounced “You-Old-Maid” - but with no d’s) collaborates with developers to unleash their creativity across all aspects of data and technology. Leveraging her past experience as a Solutions Architect for some of MongoDB’s most demanding customers, Karen loves to trigger that “aha” moment in the minds of developers - when they recognize a better path to simplify, enhance, and accelerate their projects in ways they never thought possible. Prior to MongoDB, Karen spent most of her career working with video game developers as a Solutions Architect and Integration Engineer at Nvidia, Amazon, and Twitch. In her free time, Karen embarrasses her 2 kids, spoils her dog, and feeds her addiction to adventure travel - not necessarily in that order.
KarenHuaulme.name: Karen Huaulme
KarenHuaulme.title: Principal Developer Advocate, MongoDB

FrancescoSciuti.bio: A talented and accomplished programmer extremely competent after several years of experience in enterprise programming , high skilled in web development (frontend and backend) and in team project management. I have a keen interest in new technologies and in IT development and I’m always upgrading and evaluating my knowledge and skills to stay at the cutting-edge of web development. My outstanding verbal and written communication skills let me involved in lots of meetings, workshop and courses both in Sicily and in Italy as a speaker and tech event organizer. Focused on continual professional and technological improvement: books, courses, articles, forums and regular attender of tech events where I can meet new and interesting people with which exchange as much as possible ideas and technical knowledge. I want to put myself in challenges both in the personal and professional side and this is way I’m involved ,as an active contributor, in many Italian communities (Angular ,React, Javascript ,GDG, PUG, etc…) and I contribute as a counselor to CoderDojo Foundation (Computational youth learning). I’ve worked for a long time as a employee and then as a freelancer, but nowadays I has my own company: Acadevmy – Software Factory, founded with my friends Andrea and Salvo.
FrancescoSciuti.name: Francesco Sciuti
FrancescoSciuti.title: Microsoft MVP & CEO @ Acadevmy srl

CarlosMota.bio: Android team lead at WIT Software, he can easily be spotted there working on the company RCS solution. An enthusiastic for new technology and always trying to reach those last 20% of all of his side projects that seem to be really far away, he loves to share his knowledge with others either by giving talks, teaching, writing or along with a cold beer in the nearest pub. GDG Coimbra organizer and Kotlin evangelist, he also has a huge passion for travel, photography, space and the occasional run.
CarlosMota.name: Carlos Mota
CarlosMota.shortBio: Lead Software Engineer at WIT Software
CarlosMota.title: Lead Software Engineer at WIT Software

CarloLucera.bio: Conosciuto sul Web come HatDroid, Carlo è un entusiasta delle nuove tecnologie ed uno sviluppatore Android. Da sempre alla ricerca di nuove tecniche e strategie per migliorarsi.
CarloLucera.name: Carlo Lucera
CarloLucera.title: HatDroid! Android & Flutter dev

YahyaBayramoglu.bio: Yahya Bayramoğlu is a passionate Android Developer from Turkey and currently working at Uber in Amsterdam. He has been developing for Android Platform since 2012, and constantly adapt himself with the platform changes and requirements and always follows up the new cool things on industry.
YahyaBayramoglu.name: Yahya Bayramoglu
YahyaBayramoglu.title: Android Engineer, Uber

NicolaPedot.bio: Cresciuto professionalmente in azienda di sviluppo software di servizi bancari, da 5 anni svolgo attività di consulenza sviluppo e trasferimento tecnologico per piccole/medie imprese. Da sempre appassionato di comunità informatiche locali.
NicolaPedot.name: Nicola Pedot
NicolaPedot.title: Informatelier.it Software Craftsman

FaizMalkani.bio: I'm a digital product designer, leading design at Agrahyah Technologies, with a focus on user experience and conversational design, and I occasionally write code for the frontend web and mobile. I'm passionate about inclusive design and accessible tech, and love all things community. I also frequently speak at tech conferences and mentor product teams both independently as well as a Google for Startups mentor.
FaizMalkani.name: Faiz Malkani
FaizMalkani.title: Agrahyah Technologies

MatteoTesti.bio: Matteo Testi is an entrepreneur with a strong background in Computational Neuroscience and Data Science with a focus on Deep Learning models and Cloudera Ecosystem. He founded Deep Learning Italia the biggest e-learning platform on Artificial Intelligence area in the Italian language. He was one of the technical writers for the Artificial Intelligence Italian white paper. In January 2018 he founded Icaro Artificial Intelligence solution a Fintech company with a focus on Deep Learning models for Asset Allocation.
MatteoTesti.name: Matteo Testi
MatteoTesti.title: Deep Learning Italia

ValentinaPierpaoli.bio: Asking “why” supporter. Collaborative work believer. Research-Driven thinker
ValentinaPierpaoli.name: Valentina Pierpaoli
ValentinaPierpaoli.title: Digital Product Designer @ Uqido

ManuelTrebbi.bio: My name is Manuel, I am 28 years old, I have been a programmer since I was 18, I am currently a consultant for Innoteam srl. In 2017 I had a motorcycle accident and I lost a foot, from there with great difficulty I started a path that brought me to the national podiums of Paralympic athletics.
ManuelTrebbi.name: Manuel Trebbi
ManuelTrebbi.title: Senior Developer

SonnyZanfardino.bio: Sono il fondatore di 5 Step to ROI e un business strategist aziendale. Sono una persona entusiasta e curiosa di lanciarsi in nuove attività o progetti.  Dal 2015 mi occupo di strategia aziendale.
SonnyZanfardino.name: Sonny Zanfardino
SonnyZanfardino.title: Consulente | Project Manager

AshitaPrasad.bio: Ashita is a die hard Flutterista and creator of Flutter Gems (https://fluttergems.dev), a curated Flutter package guide which is trusted by more than 10000 Flutter developers across the globe.
AshitaPrasad.name: Ashita Prasad
AshitaPrasad.title: Creator, fluttergems.dev

FrancescoFullone.bio: I'm Francesco Fullone business designer, consultant, and mentor and investor in technology companies with a focus on sustainability or social impact. I help companies (in any stage) to better define their business propositions and to create options to validate them. I also advise companies to better organize themselves in order to reach their goals. I founded, and I contribute to Apropos, a company which helps communities, companies, and local groups to organize conference and workshops. If you attended an international conference about web technologies in Italy, you met me as a speaker, organizer, or attendee. I'm the president of the GrUSP, a no-profit association that encourages good practices in web development since 2002. I also founded companies such as Flowing (previously known as Ideato), where I contributed to its growth for more than ten years creating an innovative and quality reference for the development agencies in Italy.
FrancescoFullone.name: Francesco Fullone
FrancescoFullone.shortBio: consultant, entrepreneur, community leader and advisor
FrancescoFullone.title: consultant, entrepreneur, community leader and advisor

MichelMurabito.bio: Deputy CTO by day, Developer in the soul, Superhero wannabe by night. Attualmente ricopre la carica di Deputy Chief Technical Officer in Liscor S.p.A, classe 1986 nato a Torino e cresciuto in Sicilia, inizia a scrivere software per gioco a 12 anni. Primo lavoro a 18 anni come Sviluppatore Software, da lì inizia ad esplorare vari contesti e nuove opportunità di crescita professionale. Lavora come dipendente e come libero professionista collaborando ad alcuni progetti tecnologici per la Regione Siciliana e il MiBACT. Contribuisce alla creazione di numerose startup digital e di prodotti innovativi per grossi clienti internazionali. Tra il 2015 e il 2017 si occupa di relazioni con gli sviluppatori, nel team di Developer Relations per una grossa multinazionale Americana. Tra le più grandi passioni quella di raccontare le nuove tecnologie e come gli sviluppatori possono aiutare a creare prodotti migliori; nel triennio 2017/2019 ha partecipato come speaker a 80 eventi e conferenze in Italia ed Europa.
MichelMurabito.name: Michel Murabito
MichelMurabito.title: Deputy CTO @Liscor (Gruppo @Lutech)

FabrizioWaldner.bio: Recently joined Google as Site Reliability Engineer after 5 years as Unix System Administrator in the financial sector.
FabrizioWaldner.name: Fabrizio Waldner
FabrizioWaldner.title: Google, Site Reliability Engineer

NavSingh.bio: He is a professional Android developer. Apart from his day to day job, He spend his time to learn new technologies/frameworks. He is also an Organizer at GDG-Montreal. He also work as Android instructor at Caster.io and mentor at Udacity. During his free he loves to watch Netflix, or you can find him at Gym.
NavSingh.name: Nav Singh
NavSingh.title: Android developer at Manulife

GiovannaDeVincenzo.bio: Data scientist di Infocamere, cofounder di R-Ladies Bari e data visualization lover. Dopo la laurea in Economia, ha frequentato un Master in Data Science e ha scoperto la sua vera passione: raccontare i dati. Specializzata in R, data analytics e data visualization, ha ottenuto di recente la certificazione come Tableau Desktop Specialist. Ama la tecnologia, l'innovazione e la tecno inclusione. Nel 2018 ha fondato la community delle R-Ladies Bari, un gruppo locale che si rifà a RLadies Global, un’organizzazione internazionale non-profit il cui scopo è di promuovere diversità ed equità di genere nella comunità di utenti di R. Questo il suo credo: limiti e cliché non esistono se c'è passione e motivazione in quel che si fa
GiovannaDeVincenzo.name: Giovanna de Vincenzo
GiovannaDeVincenzo.title: Data Scientist @InfoCamere, Founder R-Ladies Bari

SaraIacozza.bio: Dottorata in Neuroscienze e psicologia cognitiva, ora mi occupo di alfabetizzazione dati e consulenza. La mia missione è supportare coloro che si avvicinano al mondo dei dati venendo da settori non tradizionalmente legati ad essi.
SaraIacozza.name: Sara Iacozza
SaraIacozza.title: Data advocate

ParvaneShafiei.bio: Parvaneh is a senior Data scientist in EY with more than 5 years of experience in applying Advanced Analytics & Machine Learning for business problems & identifying the best practices tailored for each client.
ParvaneShafiei.name: Parvane Shafiei
ParvaneShafiei.title: Data scientist, Founder R-Ladies Milano

MarcoGomiero.bio: I'm working as Uniwhere Tech Lead, where I manage the end-to-end development of a platform with half a million users. I'm a Kotlin lover with a Computer Engineering degree, I have experience with native Android and native iOS development, as well as cross-platform development with React Native, Flutter and Kotlin Multiplatform. In my spare time I write and maintain open source code, I share my dev experience by speaking at confs and organizing events with the Google Developer Group Venezia and I play basketball.
MarcoGomiero.name: Marco Gomiero
MarcoGomiero.title: Tech Lead @ Uniwhere

GianSegato.bio: Gian Segato is the CEO and founder of Uniwhere, an app that is redesigning how college email works. He graduated in Economics and he's skilled in machine learning, growth engineering and venture investment. His company has been included among the top 100 startups in Berlin and has been featured in several international media outlets, from SkyNews24 to The Huffington Post. He's been awarded Italian of the Year by the Italian Embassy in Germany.
GianSegato.name: Gian Segato
GianSegato.title: Uniwhere founder

LynnLangit.bio: Cloud Architect working with remote dev teams world-wide to build cloud solutions. Author of 30 LinkedIn Learning Cloud/Data courses with over 4 million student views. https://www.linkedin.com/learning/instructors/lynn-langit
LynnLangit.name: Lynn Langit
LynnLangit.shortBio: CEO Lynn Langit Consulting LLC - Google Developer Expert Cloud - AWS Community Hero - Microsoft Regional Director
LynnLangit.title: CEO Lynn Langit Consulting LLC - Google Developer Expert Cloud - AWS Community Hero - Microsoft Regional Director

NadiaBenedetti.bio: Advanced Trainer in Ludo-pedagogia, Facilitatrice Serious Play e Game Thinking Coach, sono specializzata nel migliorare la performance individuale e di squadra attraverso le dinamiche del gioco. In particolare costruisco percorsi coinvolgenti che invitano i partecipanti a mettersi in azione, esercitare le soft skills e sperimentare comportamenti più efficaci per gestire il cambiamento.
NadiaBenedetti.name: Nadia Benedetti
NadiaBenedetti.shortBio: Playnbe Founder -Change in action in a playful way
NadiaBenedetti.title: Playnbe Founder -Change in action in a playful way

MariaStimolo.bio: Le parole sono importanti, saperle comunicare ancora di più. Durante gli anni universitari mi chiedevo come avrei potuto unire gli studi umanistici, la passione per la scrittura e la curiosità verso il settore della comunicazione utilizzando i nuovi media. Tutto ciò ha portato ad avvicinarmi al mondo della comunicazione digitale. Mi sono accorta concretamente di quanto una buona strategia di digital marketing si fondi sulla consapevolezza della forza delle parole, così mi sono concentrata soprattutto sul Content Marketing e sulle tematiche inerenti al Personal Branding . Sono stata community manager GDGCatania e WTM Ambassador e formatrice nelle attività del Coderdojo Etneo. Da due anni mi occupo di content marketing e di strategie digitali per Crm4, un'azienda di sviluppo software.
MariaStimolo.name: Maria Stimolo
MariaStimolo.title: Content marketing, comunicazione digitale

GoceAnastasovski.bio: Goce started working with Android in 2014 for alarm.com (a security and home automation company) where he worked on an app that would let customers control various IoT devices, such as locks, garage doors, in their home. Since then, he has transitioned to a Mobile Video Tech Lead role at alarm.com in Washington D.C. where he works closely with several Android and iOS engineers. In his free time, you will find Goce traveling, cooking or learning a new spoken language.
GoceAnastasovski.name: Goce Anastasovski
GoceAnastasovski.shortBio: alarm.com, Mobile Tech Lead and Android Developer
GoceAnastasovski.title: alarm.com, Mobile Tech Lead and Android Developer

NicolaGuglielmi.bio: I started my first computer at 10 and I never stopped researching and learning each single day from then. I’m a technology enthusiast, not meaning only the IT ones but every product of the mind that extends human abilities to solve a problem. I love solve problems, I can safely say that is what I'm doing since I started to work, and perhaps before.In the last few years I investigated the effectiveness of team management and the extraordinary results that a well motivated and focused team can reach. As a matter of fact, I learned every day how to effectively manage resources, how to resolve issues to build great teams and keep it running at the best.
NicolaGuglielmi.name: Nicola Guglielmi
NicolaGuglielmi.title: Innovation Manager | Team Lead

NicolaCorti.bio: Nicola Corti has been an Android Software Engineer since 2.2, and a Free and Open Source lover for as long as he remembers. He’s currently working as an Android Infrastructure Engineer at Spotify, building the audio experience for millions of Android users worldwide. Nicola usually calls himself a ‘community addict’. He can’t survive without learning every day, sharing knowledge, and having fun with other developers. He’s also currently managing the GDG chapter in Stockholm and the one in Pisa. In his free time, he also loves open-source, photography and running.
NicolaCorti.name: Nicola Corti
NicolaCorti.title: Android Infrastructure Engineer @ Spotifys

PawanKumar.bio: I'm the first GDE (Google Developer Expert) for Flutter in India. Also, I'm a passionate Android & Xamarin developer and always excited about learning new technologies as well as mentoring and helping others get started in their programming career. I love open-sourcing cool projects on Github and helping the Flutter & Android community regularly on Facebook, YouTube, and other platforms. I also gave talks and did code labs at few places about flutter and I make flutter tutorials on my youtube channel MTechViral (100+).
PawanKumar.name: PawanKumar
PawanKumar.title: Google Developer Expert for Flutter

GiovanniLaquidara.bio: Started my development journey using Ada83 in the Archipelago of Real Time Systems years and years ago, migrated into Object Oriented country surviving to C, Python and Java. With these in the bag I've decided to leave for the newborn country of the Mobile Development choosing Android as a first town. I was not alone in the journey, many communities and events made me safe and satisfied and I liked to give back speaking about my past trips and helping the others during around the fire meetups (GDG, Facebook DevC, Mobile Tea and others) conferences like Droidcons and Codemotions. I'm ready to pack my bag for VR/AR worlds and AI new lands and currently helping Huawei ecosystem to be the safest and smartest harbour for developers!
GiovanniLaquidara.name: Giovanni Laquidara
GiovanniLaquidara.title: Huawei Developer Advocate

BlessingKrofegha.bio: Blessing Krofegha is a dynamic Software Engineer with a drive to create marketable solutions to global businesses. He is also a Technical author at Smashing Magazine and LogRocket.
BlessingKrofegha.name: Blessing Krofegha
BlessingKrofegha.title: Software Engineer and Technical Author

MirellaOrsi.bio: Mirella Orsi is a London based freelance Science Writer, Science Communicator and Chief Coordinator of the BSS-HUB. Her work focuses on the communication of science-related topics, education, and Public Outreach (EPO) with broad expertise in the History of women in Science. Her writings on Science for the popular press have covered a range of topics in medicine, chemistry and physics, ranging from the History of Science to the latest STEM discoveries. She has written for a variety of outlets and interviewed some of the most influential scientists, including two Nobel Prize laureates. She has been a guest speaker and a moderator in many science festivals including the Science & Philosophy Festival in Foligno and the Futuro Remoto Festival in Naples. She has been the co-organiser of the panel “Science and Politics” at the CNR in Rome and of the 'Between Science and Society' conference in Naples. Member of the NUJ and The Association of British Science Writers (ABSW), she has been a coordinator and tutor in EU journalism internship projects. She has a master’s degree in Chemistry and Pharmaceutical Technology from University of Naples Federico II.
MirellaOrsi.name: Mirella Orsi
MirellaOrsi.shortBio: Freelance Science Writer, divulgatrice scientifica e coordinatrice di BSS-HUB dell’Italian Institute for the Future(IIF).
MirellaOrsi.title: Freelance Science Writer, divulgatrice scientifica e coordinatrice di BSS-HUB dell’Italian Institute for the Future(IIF).
